info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 20 at 3:05PM EDT until July 20 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...The following counties, in northern Kentucky, Mason and Robertson.
* WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 305 PM EDT, Radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Lewisburg, Mount Olivet, Sardis, Alhambra, Lowell, Peed, Murphysville, Abigail, Mays Lick, Burika, US Route 62 at State Route 616, Mitchells Mill, Blue Licks Battlefield, Blue Licks Springs, US Route 62 at State Route 875, Piqua, Hittville, Helena, Fleming-Mason Airport and Kentontown.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING
